moves.3. dxe5 Ng4 4. Bf4: I play this bishop move first so as to meet 4... Bc5? with 5. e3 and White has a winning advantage.
moves.4... Bb4+ 5. Nc3 Nc6 6. Nf3 f6 7. exf6 Q: Better is 7... Bxc3+ first.  Then 8. bxc3 Qf6 9. Qd2 and White is doing well.
moves.8. Bd2 O-O 9. h3 Nge5: Now Stockfish 9 gives 10. Nd5 Bxd2+ 11. Qxd2 Qd8 12. Nxe5 Nxe5 13. e3 c6 14. Nf4 with a much better position.
moves.13... Rf8:
Better is 13... Rf5 14. Bd5+ Kf8.

Now Stockfish 9 likes 14. Rd1 Be7 15. Nb5 Bd8 16. Bc3 Rf5 and now either 17. Bd5+ or 17. Be4.  
 If 16... a6? 17. Bd5+ Kh8 18. Rg1/
moves.14. Bd5+ Kh8 15. Ne4:
This centralized knight will prove useful.

However he computer prefers  15. Nb5!? with the idea of Bxd2+ 16. Kxd2 Rxf2+ 17. Kc3 d6 18. Nxc7 Rb8 19. Nb5 Rf6 20. Raf1 and White is doing great.
moves.15... Be7: Black would have been fine after  15... d6.
moves.16. O-O-O: Slightly better is 16. Bc3 and then if 16... Nb4?? 17. Rg1.
moves.16... Ne5: Missing the best continuation with 16... Nb4 17. Bxb4 Bxb4 18. c5 equal.
moves.17. Bc3 Nf3:
Too hasty.

Black is significantly better off with 17... d6.
moves.18. Rhg1: Offering a sacrifice for the attack.
moves.18... Nxg1 19. Rxg1: Now Black's of development and exposed kingside are going to backfire bigtime.
moves.19... Bf6: Black dies more slowly after 19... Rg8 20. Bxg8 Kxg8 21. Rxg7+ Kf8 22. Rxh7.
moves.20. Nxf6: This will clear a path to the king.
